body_html:
Use the C API functions TF_StringEncode and TF_StringDecode to access the string content of TF_Tensor objects.
…
On Fri, Apr 14, 2017 at 11:54 AM, Anthony Platanios < ***@***.***> wrote: That sounds great, thanks! :) I have one last question regarding the memory structure of tensors, just to make sure I got everything clear. For tensors with data type String, how to you signify the end of each string? That is, what is the memory structure for String tensors? As an example, let's say we have Tensor(Tensor("abc", "defog"), Tensor("1", "56")) which is [1, 2] shape tensor. How would that be represented in the TF_Tensor buffer? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. string content of TF_Tensor objects.

body:
Use the C API functions TF_StringEncode and TF_StringDecode to access the
string content of TF_Tensor objects.

On Fri, Apr 14, 2017 at 11:54 AM, Anthony Platanios <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> That sounds great, thanks! :)
>
> I have one last question regarding the memory structure of tensors, just
> to make sure I got everything clear. For tensors with data type String, how
> to you signify the end of each string? That is, what is the memory
> structure for String tensors?
>
> As an example, let's say we have Tensor(Tensor("abc", "defog"),
> Tensor("1", "56")) which is [1, 2] shape tensor. How would that be
> represented in the TF_Tensor buffer?
>
